meanings.definition: An area of low-lying ground adjacent to a river, formed mainly of river sediments and subject to flooding.
meanings.sent1: The floodplain was submerged after heavy rain.
meanings.sent2: The houses on the floodplain were evacuated during the flood.
meanings.sent3: The ducks enjoyed swimming in the floodplain after the storm.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a floodplain of ideas, overflowing with creativity.
meanings.sent5: The lush greenery of the floodplain contrasted with the muddy river water.

meanings.definition: The flat, wide area of land along a river that is covered with water when the river floods.
meanings.sent1: During the rainy season, the floodplain becomes a temporary lake.
meanings.sent2: Farmers utilize the nutrient-rich soil of the floodplain for agriculture.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the floodplain was a giant swimming pool.
meanings.sent4: Her smile flooded the room like a bright floodplain.
meanings.sent5: The floodplain stretched out like a tranquil watercolor painting.
